intro: Tricostularia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered tricostularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
